author: 52b80d37c4f281803d000002
text: How much more grievous are the consequences of anger than the causes of it.

author: 52b81783c4f281803d000003
text: Great minds discuss ideas. Average minds discuss events. Small minds discuss people.

author: 52bc072547031fad0532aa89
text: Ideas are like rabbits. You get a couple and learn how to handle them, and pretty soon you have a dozen.

author: 52bc0fe247031fad0532aa8b
text: The sea is everything. It covers seven tenths of the terrestrial globe. Its breath is pure and healthy. It is an immense desert, where man is never lonely, for he feels life stirring on all sides.

author: 52b80d37c4f281803d000002
text: Begin - to begin is half the work, let half still remain; again begin this, and thou wilt have finished.

author: 52bd576f47031fad0532aa8f
text: It's the job that's never started that takes longest to finish.

author: 52bd5b1133f017b72d8f503d
text: College is a place where a professor's lecture notes go straight to the students' lecture notes, without passing through the brains of either.

author: 52bd61e114c5e1eb2eca04c3
text: You are not here merely to make a living. You are here in order to enable the world to live more amply, with greater vision, with a finer spirit of hope and achievement. You are here to enrich the world, and you impoverish yourself if you forget the errand.

author: 52bd670b14c5e1eb2eca04c5
text: A man is rich in proportion to the number of things he can afford to let alone.

author: 52bd6b2c14c5e1eb2eca04c7
text: I would rather be ashes than dust! I would rather be a superb meteor, every atom of me in magnificent glow, than a sleepy and permanent planet.

author: 52bd8d7014c5e1eb2eca04c9
text: What have you done that's so great? Do you create anything, or just criticize others' work and belittle their motivations?

author: 52bd966214c5e1eb2eca04cb
text: All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better.

author: 52bd9e4a14c5e1eb2eca04cd
text: If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.

author: 52bda2bc14c5e1eb2eca04cf
text: If we only wanted to be happy, it would be easy; but we want to be happier than other people, and that is almost always difficult, since we think them happier than they are.

author: 52bda5f114c5e1eb2eca04d1
text: The man who makes everything that leads to happiness depends upon himself, and not upon other men, has adopted the very best plan for living happily. This is the man of moderation, the man of manly character and of wisdom.

author: 52bda93f14c5e1eb2eca04d3
text: I hope I shall possess firmness and virtue enough to maintain what I consider the most enviable of all titles, the character of an honest man.

author: 52c1946b14c5e1eb2eca04d5
text: There is no rule on how to write. Sometimes it comes easily and perfectly; sometimes it's like drilling rock and then blasting it out with charges.

author: 52c19a7c14c5e1eb2eca04d7
text: Prohibit the taking of omens, and do away with superstitious doubts. Then, until death itself comes, no calamity need be feared.

author: 52c19ded14c5e1eb2eca04d9
text: In the end, everything is a gag.

author: 52c1a2a314c5e1eb2eca04db
text: I am easily satisfied with the very best.

author: 52c1a89914c5e1eb2eca04dd
text: Either write something worth reading or do something worth writing.

author: 52d5a166b7715f647e08ddf9
text: Everybody is a genius. But if you judge a fish by its ability to climb a tree, it will live its whole life believing that it is stupid.

author: 52d5a3d4b7715f647e08ddfb
text: I don't pity any man who does hard work worth doing. I admire him. I pity the creature who does not work, at whichever end of the social scale he may regard himself as being.

author: 52d5ac22b4156bb2051a8518
text: People do not lack strength; they lack will.

author: 52d5b0a8b4156bb2051a851a
text: It's kind of fun to do the impossible.

author: 52d85379b4156bb2051a851d
text: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.

author: 52d856bdb4156bb2051a851f
text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.

author: 52d9551eb4156bb2051a8521
text: An educated man is not one whose memory is trained to carry a few dates in history—he is one who can accomplish things.

author: 52d95a21b4156bb2051a8524
text: People who are unable to motivate themselves must be content with mediocrity, no matter how impressive their other talents.

author: 52d95ec3b4156bb2051a8526
text: Common sense is not so common.

author: 52de977f62f0f2757b99adf1
text: 640K ought to be enough for anybody.

author: 52dee22333c3051102b8923b
text: A man who does not think for himself does not think at all.

author: 52dee80633c3051102b8923d
text: Sure, it might be what you've always done. But that doesn't make it true, or right, or best. It just means that you already tried it.

author: 52e80fd333c3051102b8923f
text: I know but one freedom, and that is the freedom of the mind.

author: 52e916a833c3051102b89241
text: Hell, there are no rules here - we're trying to accomplish something.

author: 52e91d4133c3051102b89243
text: Tact is the art of making a point without making an enemy.

author: 52e9282533c3051102b89245
text: By desiring little, a poor man makes himself rich.

author: 52e92af933c3051102b89247
text: Too often I would hear men boast of the miles covered that day, rarely of what they had seen.

author: 52ea738b33c3051102b89249
text: An intellectual is a man who takes more words than necessary to tell more than he knows.

author: 52ea7c5833c3051102b8924b
text: No grand idea was ever born in a conference, but a lot of foolish ideas have died there.

author: 52ea819133c3051102b8924d
text: First they ignore you, then they laugh at you, then they fight you, then you win.

author: 52f2524433c3051102b8924f
text: It is not the strongest of the species that survives, nor the most intelligent that survives. It is the one that is the most adaptable to change.

author: 52f257c233c3051102b89251
text: A liberal is a man too broadminded to take his own side in a quarrel.

author: 52f2716833c3051102b89253
text: A man who suffers before it is necessary, suffers more than is necessary.

author: 52f3b3b333c3051102b89255
text: I would never die for my beliefs because I might be wrong.

author: 52f3bc2f33c3051102b89257
text: Everybody denies I am a genius - but nobody ever called me one!

author: 52fa091533c3051102b89259
text: Art is the elimination of the unnecessary.

author: 52fa0c8033c3051102b8925b
text: Bisexuality immediately doubles your chances for a date on Saturday night.

author: 52fa10af33c3051102b8925d
text: French is the language that turns dirt into romance.

author: 52fe21cb389039813db49839
text: How disappointing... you are too early, please come back at the right time.

author: 5306080d84fbbbe129330437
text: The reading of all good books is like a conversation with the finest minds of past centuries.

author: 5306078184fbbbe129330435
text: I don't care if I fall as long as someone else picks up my gun and keeps on shooting.

author: 5306084584fbbbe129330438
text: I have noticed even people who claim everything is predestined, and that we can do nothing to change it, look before they cross the road.

author: 530607cb84fbbbe129330436
text: It always seems impossible until it's done.

author: 5306096584fbbbe12933043f
text: Many are stubborn in pursuit of the path they have chosen, few in pursuit of the goal.

author: 5306073e84fbbbe129330434
text: Small minds are concerned with the extraordinary, great minds with the ordinary.

author: 530b08c8452b61fa2d125730
text: How much pain they have cost us, the evils which have never happened.

author: 530b1115452b61fa2d125732
text: A conservative is a man with two perfectly good legs who, however, has never learned how to walk forward.

author: 530b1357452b61fa2d125734
text: Man is condemned to be free; because once thrown into the world, he is responsible for everything he does.

author: 530b197c452b61fa2d125736
text: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.

author: 5310498f452b61fa2d125738
text: The real passion of the twentieth century is servitude.

author: 53104e0f452b61fa2d12573a
text: All of my misfortunes come from having thought too well of my fellows.

author: 53105168452b61fa2d12573c
text: Talking is often a torment for me, and I need many days of silence to recover from the futility of words.

author: 531056d3452b61fa2d12573e
text: By believing passionately in something that still does not exist, we create it. The nonexistent is whatever we have not sufficiently desired.

author: 53142197452b61fa2d125740
text: Anything becomes interesting if you look at it long enough.

author: 53142856452b61fa2d125742
text: Social progress can be measured by the social position of the female sex.

author: 53143265452b61fa2d125744
text: Most people do not really want freedom, because freedom involves responsibility, and most people are frightened of responsibility.

author: 5314380f452b61fa2d125746
text: Time, which changes people, does not alter the image we have retained of them.

author: 53143ad7452b61fa2d125748
text: Sometimes I get an idea for cinema. And when you get an idea that you fall in love with, this is a glorious day.

author: 53143ec4452b61fa2d12574a
text: The opinion of the world does not affect me. I have placed as the real values in my life what follows when I am dead.

author: 531d7bec452b61fa2d12574c
text: The whole difference between construction and creation is exactly this: that a thing constructed can only be loved after it is constructed; but a thing created is loved before it exists.

author: 531d81fe452b61fa2d12574e
text: Boredom: the desire for desires.

author: 531d878e452b61fa2d125750
text: I put my heart and my soul into my work, and have lost my mind in the process.

author: 531d89d5452b61fa2d125752
text: I prefer drawing to talking. Drawing is faster, and leaves less room for lies.

author: 531d8c88452b61fa2d125754
text: They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.

author: 5322a425452b61fa2d125756
text: Self-education is, I firmly believe, the only kind of education there is.

author: 5322a750452b61fa2d125758
text: Success is dependent on effort.

author: 5322a9e7452b61fa2d12575a
text: Nothing is enough for the man to whom enough is too little.

author: 5322b073452b61fa2d12575c
text: I became insane, with long intervals of horrible sanity.

author: 5322b484452b61fa2d12575e
text: We always long for the forbidden things, and desire what is denied us.

author: 532939e4452b61fa2d125760
text: The more you know, the less you need.

author: 53293c54452b61fa2d125762
text: As a rule, men worry more about what they can't see than about what they can.

author: 532da4f6452b61fa2d125764
text: The mind is not a vessel to be filled but a fire to be kindled.

author: 532da6d2452b61fa2d125766
text: Change does not roll in on the wheels of inevitability, but comes through continuous struggle.

author: 532da8f5452b61fa2d125768
text: We are like chameleons, we take our hue and the color of our moral character, from those who are around us.
